radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended with sludge without definite wall thickening or edema. There is an approximately 1.3 cm echogenic structure with shadowing in the region of the gallbladder neck compatible with an immobile stone. The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 6 mm. The pancreas is not well visualized. The spleen shows normal echogenicity. Limited views of the right kidney show no hydronephrosis.
